Germs that cause coughs and colds spread in crowded places. Wherever possible, 
avoid crowded  places to help reduce exposure to disease-causing agents.
Indoor air pollution, for example, due to use of coal or wood for cooking indoors 
as well as indoor smoking of tobacco products increases risk of respiratory infections.
Many diseases such as whooping cough and measles that can manifest with 
respiratory ailments can be prevented by immunizing children against these diseases.
